lines.text: I wonder who thought up sex in the first place, Danny?
I-I think it was Madonna, actually.
Look at the buses, watch 'em.
Why, what are they gonna do?
They pull in, and then they pull out, and they turn, and they back up.
[after watching a couple do a body shot in a bar]
Normal couples don't do that. They're from college.
No matter how long I wait I can't be a painter, and I can't play tennis, and I'm not an artist. But I know how to do something, and I can love.
[to his wife about their daughters]
Honey, you're doing fine. They're not drug addicts; they're not axe murderers. ...They're not *Democrats*.
I love you every minute. I love you more than band music and cookie-making.
I love to drink, Ernie.
Yeah?
Yeah, it makes ya feel good. Is that why people drink?
Some to be happy, some to forget, some to be brave.
Ya know, I feel really brave, Ernie.
No, only cowards get brave that way.

[quoting one of her teachers]
Yeah, and she also told me that people like us, they - boys can try to take advantage and that they'll try to coitus us. So if that should ever happen, to say, "No!"
Oh. Okay.
"Stop right there!"
Good. That's excellent advice. What else did she say to you?
"Don't put gum under the cafeteria table! How many times do I have to tell you?"
Have you ever done it before?

Well, yeah, kind of. You see the guys at work, they chipped in and they found this girl and she had a reputation. There was a lot of kissing and hugging and a lot of rubbing, and I kind of finished before I was supposed to. You have to be a guy to understand that.
Are you ready? Cause I'm ready!
No Daniel, uh, I'm not ready.
Ohh
I was thinking we could wait 'til the next holiday cause holidays are special.
oh cause I feel special right now Carla.
I love polytechnic school!
Mother, being gay is not a diagnosis. It's not a disease I'm going to recover from, or a phase I'm going to outgrow.
I know what being gay is, okay? I give to gay causes. I support gay parades. They even gave me a plaque.
Yes! So why support them and not me?
I feel like I'm the mother of a dedicated underachiever, a gay workaholic, and Carla, who thinks she can conquer this whole terrifying world that we live in.
Honey, you're doing fine. They're not drug addicts. They're not axe murderers. They're not *Democrats.*
I also enrolled her in a calligraphy class, an origami class. I even got her into that...
She doesn't want to do those things. They don't interest her. They don't work for her.
Maybe Carla doesn't know what works for her.
And you do.
I think so. I'm her mother.
That's why she tried to hitchhike over 200 miles to get back here?

[getting emotional]
I didn't want to put her in that place! But I had to. I had no other choice. She needed professional help. Now it is Carla turn, and I am going to protect her! And nobody's going to tell me how to do it, not even you, Radley. No!

[whispering to Carla about Elizabeth]
She's a little uptight.
What?
It-it's tight. This shoe's a little tight.
[Danny, dressed in a dog costume, is introducing himself to Elizabeth]
Don't worry, 'cause I've been house trained.
A-Another reason I got mad is 'cause I didn't want you to think I was dumb.
I could never think that.
[Danny is proposing to Carla, right in the middle of Caroline's wedding]
You know, I thought our worst problem was gonna be parking.
When you reach a certain age and you're not talking to your children, I think you're missing a very important part of the journey.
